name: Natto Spring Rolls
description: Imagine biting into a freshly fried spring roll, its shell breaking off in crispy, golden-brown shards to a piping-hot center of natto beans. The taste is still distinctly natto-esque, but with a kind of maturity and softness that is really pleasant.
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon dried wakame (about 1/4 cup rehydrated), finely chopped
1 teaspoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the natto with the seaweed and scallions. Add the packets of soy sauce and mustard that come with the natto, or use the seasonings listed above.
Have ready a stack of defrosted spring roll wrappers.
Roll the natto mixture in the spring rolls, sealing your rolls closed with a dab of the cornstarch slurry.
In a wok, heat the oil to 350°F. Deep the spring rolls until the shells are golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Serve immediately.
